column4: So, i have an external hdd, it's always "busy" or "being used", and when i unplug it, ubuntu thinks the drive is still connected and busy. is there any way for me to be able to use this drive again?
no it should be /dev/sdc1 or sdc2 etc
sudo swapoff && sudo umount /dev/sdc1   that should safely remove the device
swapoff told me how to use it
disk utility still sees it as a busy drive
sudo sync && sudo swapoff /dev/sdc2 && sudo umount /dev/sdc1
reconnect it and then run the last commands I said
about how long should it sit there with a cursor waiting to do the commands?
usually there is nothing to sync. But if the is lots of data then that might be why it was still busy
it's still syncing, it's a 500gb drive if that matters
I didn;t say it was syncing. Try Ctrl+c    Then: sudo sync    see if it takes long time again
yup, it looks like it's taking a long time to sync
nope, all of my swaps are off
